intro: Trianthema pilosum, commonly known as the hairy yellow catchfly, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its succulent leaves and vibrant yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its hairy stems and leaves help reduce water loss, making it drought-tolerant. It produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer.
